customFields.Priority P1 to P4: P2 - Core Functions (Do core functions work?)

inline.description:
Channel - Make Private
–––––––––––––––––––––––––
  1. In a command line window set to the directory where 'mmctl' is installed in, run "mmctl auth login https://mysql.test.mattermost.com --name mysql.test --username john.doe --password mysupersecret"
inline.expectedResult: • You will get feedback saying "credentials for mysql.test stored"

customFields.Important notes about this step: Note: Enter valid username and password for a system admin user

inline.description: 1. Run "mmctl channel make_private myteam:mychannel" e.g. "mmctl channel make_private lindys-team:custom-emoji"
inline.expectedResult: • You will see the converted channel move to UNREADS in Mattermost and a system message saying "this channel has been converted to a private channel" is posted in the channel

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Story) Replace the use of the ConvertChannelToPrivate soon to be deprecated endpoint in mmctl — MM-25048
